result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

2:40 PM (64-06) Defendant James Mackenzie Hagen in court.  Attorney Kirk Bowden Obear in court for James Mackenzie Hagen.  Attorney J J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State called to the stand as a witness Officer Dillon McGuire.
Dillion McGuire duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by Attorney Crawford.
Witness identified defendant in court.
Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed in court.
Exhibit #1 offered and received into evidence.
2:43PM - Cross examination by Attorney Obear.
2:45 PM - Evidence is closed.
Argument by ADA Crawford, requesting bind over of the defendant.
Attorney Obear waives argument.
Victim in court and made a statement.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him/her over to stand trial on the charges. 
Attorney Obear acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.

2:48PM
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James Mackenzie Hagen in court.  Attorney Rock for Attorney Kirk Bowden Obear in court for James Mackenzie Hagen. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Preliminary Hearing requested, time period waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH VICTIM A.I.S. dob 11-9-1997. NO DISCUSSION ABOUT THIS CASE WITH VICTIM. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant James Mackenzie Hagen in court. Vivien TenHaken for the State. Attorney Kirk Obear for defendant. Victim not in court. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
